alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 19 at 10:33AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Imperial. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1030 AM PDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in along Highway 98 west of Imperial due to thunderstorms early this morning. Flooding is ongoing with waters slowly receding. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Myer Creek, Palm Canyon Wash, Carrizo Wash and Gert Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ocotillo and Coyote Wells. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
